hackathon-description-text: UGA Hacks is a 36­+1 hour hackathon in which students from all across the southeast will gather to create something great. Students form teams to create ANYTHING their minds come to, gaining unique experience and connections. This one­-of-­a-­kind experience is open to anyone and comes with all the perks, including mentors, free food, video game competitions, social mixers, you name it. And the best part? Getting to show off your unique innovation and bumping up your street cred! Participating is as simple as registering on this website.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of Lamar Dodd School of Art

hackathon-eligibility: Teams can be no larger than 4 people. You must be present at time of the closing ceremony to receive any awards.
hackathon-requirements: There is no constraints as to what you can make besides the hackathon rules.
hackathon-rules:
All participants must follow the MLH Code of Conduct that can be found at https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf
You must:
You may:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Amazon Dot for each team member
Raspberry Pi for each team member

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of AWS - Dell 1TB Hard Drive
Best Domain Name Registered with Domain.com

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: As the saying goes: like a good neighbor, State Farm is there. And we want you to be there too! Build the most "neighborly" hack — any hack that helps other people to be eligible to win a Amazon Echo for each member of your team.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: State Farm: Best Hack for Social Good

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=225 E Broad St, Athens, GA 30601, USA
hackathon-location-address: 225 E Broad St, Athens, GA 30601, USA
